description.narrative:
Food Security: The Project will improve the accessibility and affordability of high-efficiency fertilizer products for millions of Chinese farmer families. Kingenta's specialty products can sustainably improve crop yield and generate improved food security and higher incomes for farmers.
Environmental and Climate Benefits: The Project will reduce the use of conventional nitrogen and phosphate fertilizer in China. Higher efficiency in nutrient delivery will result in less fertilizer being applied, leading to improved productivity, less soil contamination and less pollution to the waterways and the atmosphere.
Higher Farmer Productivity: Shortage of labor in many farming families is an impediment to better farming business and higher incomes in China. The skilled labor service provided by the Project will result in improved farmer productivity.
Job Creation and SME Development: The Project will create about 10,000 direct jobs and a large number of indirect jobs in China. The Project provides also opportunities for small and medium-sized enterprises to be involved in transportation and distribution of agricultural inputs.

(Kingenta or the Sponsor), a leading compound and specialty fertilizer producer and supplier in China, has invited IFC to jointly fund a green-field project in China. A new company will be established to undertake the project, which plans to establish and operate several individual projects in China (jointly called the Project), including Crop Production Service Centers (CPS Projects) in rural farming areas and new production plants (Upgrade Projects) to upgrade local conventional fertilizer output into compound and specialty fertilizers. The development of the Project is expected to be implemented over 3 years.
